video.title: Netlify Tutorial - How to build and deploy websites using Netlify
video.description:
Netlify helps developers quickly roll out static websites. In this in-depth Netlify course for beginners, you will learn how to use the service for everything needed in modern web development, from local setup to global deployment. This video is the perfect place to start for anyone that wants to learn how to use Netlify.

💻 Detailed Notes and References: https://gist.github.com/sw-yx/167250684bb3c47edc40ad97b63d1cfb

🎥 Video by Swyx. He is an Infinite Builder working on DX at Netlify.
🐦 Twitter: @swyx

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:03:42) Part 1: 🗺️ Netlify Edge
⌨️ (00:37:15) Part 2: ⚒️ Netlify Build
⌨️ (01:02:02) Part 3: 👩🏼‍💻 Netlify Dev
⌨️ (01:24:17) Part 4: 🗒️ Netlify Forms
⌨️ (01:55:21) Part 5: 🆔 Netlify Identity
⌨️ (02:34:07) Part 6: ✍️ NetlifyCMS
⌨️ (02:59:53) Part 7: ➕ Netlify Addons: Everything Else!
⌨️ (03:18:18) Part 8: 🍻 Netlify API
⌨️ (03:25:39) Part 9: ❓ Learn More

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Cindy L.
topLevelComment.text:
Great tutorial! THANKS
How do you set up Git alias, like what you just type:  gpom => git push origin master

replies.author: JScodingMaster
replies.text: open your bash profile by typing this command: code ~/.bash_profile then write any alias you wand for example if you want to make and alias for git status write it like this:  alias s="git status" then just type s  in your git bash and it will activate the whole command, I hope this was useful.

replies.author: Shiny 345
replies.text: @Morgan Smith creating aliases straight up at ~/.bashrc works as well, but yeah, separating them into ~/.bash_aliases is better.

replies.author: Steve Reid
replies.text: No-one hiring you will care about certificates. That's why there's so much content about how to pass interviews around. They'll look at your projects and test your knowledge.

replies.author: Hemanta kakati
replies.text: certificate means nothing, build some projects with what you have learned that will be far more helpful for getting jobs than any certificates.........

replies.author: Gautam Patel
replies.text: @Xd Kiler 420 nice  but there is free courses certificate value ?

replies.author: Xd Kiler 420 nice
replies.text: They're not worth anything. You can cheat your way through to get the certificates pretty easily. And please don't spend money if it's not mandatory. If there's a free course without a certification, take it. This channel is a wonderful resource to get you started. The rest is up to you.

topLevelComment.author: Malik Bagwala
topLevelComment.text: A 3.5 hr tutorial on netlify.? Integration takes less than 15 minutes.. It has the best user experience out of other platform that I have used.

replies.author: Shiny 345
replies.text:
For just an integration, yes, it only takes 15 minutes. But Netlify has other features as well, which was covered in this video.

What a good alternative to Firebase, for multiple (small to medium-sized) sites.

replies.author: JAVAAID - Coding Interview Preparation
replies.text: whenever I learnt some framework after working hard, the next day somebody will release the newer version of it by mentioning that whatever you have learnt so far is going to deprecate in new version.....:)😂

topLevelComment.author: Food Tech Life
topLevelComment.text:
Drag and drop on their upload page. Done 😄

I recently tried Netlify but when I attached a domain it would load on my home ISP and at work but not on my cell phone providers LTE. Very strange...so I went back to Digital Ocean. 

Wow this tutorial is deep. 
Commenting before watching completely of course :)

replies.author: Food Tech Life
replies.text: Ivan St. I did wait several days/weeks but still had the same issue. So yeah didn’t want to deal with that. I guess I could have asked some one else with the same carrier to check as well and not let it be just my phone.

replies.author: Ivan Stasiuk
replies.text: The DNS records on your LTE provider was probably not up to date. So you should just wait a little bit longer, or try to clear the DNS cache, or use google dns at which you have more controll with tools like Flush Google DNS.
